Title: FlexGraph
Description:
A simple chart control for Windows delivered in form of a function DLL.
Tested in C++ (MFC, QT), C# and VB.Net.
HomeWiki:
A chart control for Windows delivered in form of a dynamically linked library.

Check out the demo and try yourself! If you do please leave me some feedback. More demos and documentation will follow soon.  Update: Added a new C# Windows Forms demo!

Features

  • Usable in lots of different Windows GUI frameworks. Tested in C++ (MFC, QT), VB.net and C#.
  • Customizable (Title bar, axis titles, border, color, grid, ...)
  • Multiple plots in one control
  • Zooming (Mousewheel or Shift+Mouseselection) / Panning 
  • Range selection (Strg + Leftclick)
  • Csv import/export (Right click menu)
  • Markers to highlight thresholds etc. (Doubleclick an axis)
  • Auto scaling possible (Doubleclick on the graph)
  • Mouse tooltip with coordinates.
  • Easy to use!

 

How easy is it?

The demo is basically just a few lines:

/* Create the control */ 
_FGHandle ControlHandle = FG_createGraphControl(m_FlexGraphContainer.GetSafeHwnd(),
                                                GraphContainerRect.left, 
                                                GraphContainerRect.top, 
                                                GraphContainerRect.Width(),
                                                GraphContainerRect.Height());

/* Add a new graph to the created control */
_FGHandle GraphHandle = FG_addGraph(ControlHandle, L"Test graph");

/* Add 1000 points */
for(unsigned i = 0; i < 10000; i++)
{
    FG_addPoint(ControlHandle, GraphHandle, i, i * i);
}

/* Autoscale and redraw */
FG_setDefaultZoom(ControlHandle);
FG_requestRedraw(ControlHandle);
 

Watch out for

FG_createGraphControl has two additional offset parameters for the control size. Those are needed in C# and QT. Just try until the window fits the control. Sorry for that... Don't know why the offsets are needed.
